Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.2743, in relation to violations of safety conditions in adult care facilities
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Aging
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Violations of safety conditions in adult care facilities. (A.2743)

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: NYS Long-Term Care Ombudsman Program.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Civil Rights

Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign into law A.4558B/S.61B, which would prohibit discrimination on the basis of gender expression or identity and expand the State's hate crimes statute to include offenses committed against someone on the basis of his or her gender expression or identity.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Member formally noted his opposition to the passage of this item:
Council Member Deutsch.

The following Council Member formally noted his abstention from voting on this item:  
Council Member Greenfield.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Prohibit discrimination on the basis of gender expression or identity. (A.4558B/S.61B)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R.2282/S.1006, the Equality Act, which would amend the Civil Rights Acts of 1964 and 1968 to include sexual orientation and gender identity as prohibited categories of discrimination or segregation with respect to employment, public accommodation and housing.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Member formally noted his opposition to the passage of this item:  
Council Member Deutsch.

The following 2 Council Members formally noted their abstention from voting on this item:  
Council Members Greenfield and King.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Equality Act (H.R.2282/S.1006)

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Public Advocate (Ms. James) adjourned to meet again on Monday, December 11, 2017.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
The Public Advocate (Ms. James)

The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

There were 47 Council Members marked present at this Meeting (which includes newly sworn-in Council Member Adams who took her ceremonial oath of office later in the Meeting).
The City Clerk Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney) performed the formal ceremony of swearing in Council Member Adrienne E. Adams as the new Council Member representing the 28th District in Queens.
